text.div:
Histology Morphology Behavior Value Set

Codes representing the structure, arrangement, and behavioral characteristics of malignant neoplasms, and cancer cells. Inclusion criteria: in situ neoplasms and malignant neoplasms. Exclusion criteria: benign neoplasms and neoplasms of unspecified behavior. Note: As the vocabulary binding is extensible within this IG, ICD-O-3 morphology codes (including behavior suffix) may also be used; they are not included in the value set for intellectual property reasons. For primary cancers, the ICD-O-3 behavior suffix should be /1, /2, or /3. For secondary cancers, the ICD-O-3 behavior suffix should be /6. Only SNOMED CT and ICD-O-3 are considered conformant to the specification. However, to be compliant with US Core Profiles, ICD-O-3 may only be used if there is no suitable code in SNOMED CT.

  • Include codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 367651003 (Malignant Neoplasm (Morphology))
  • Include codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 399919001 (Carcinoma in situ - category (morphologic abnormality))
  • Include codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 399983006 (In situ adenomatous neoplasm - category (morphologic abnormality))
  • Include these codes as defined in http://snomed.info/sct
    CodeDisplay
    399878004Malignant neoplasm with pilar differentiation (morphologic abnormality)
    253035009In situ melanocytic morphology (morphologic abnormality)
  • Exclude codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 450893003 (Papillary neoplasm, pancreatobiliary-type, with high grade intraepithelial neoplasia (morphologic abnormality))
  • Exclude codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 128640002 (Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia, grade III)
  • Exclude codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 450890000 (Glandular intraepithelial neoplasia, low grade)
  • Exclude codes from http://snomed.info/sct where concept is-a 703548001 (Atypical hyperplasia of the endometrium)

This value set includes codes based on the following rules:

concept.display: Malignant neoplasm with pilar differentiation (morphologic abnormality)
